com.stormpath.sdk.application

Interface ApplicationCriteria

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AccountStoreOptions<ApplicationCriteria>, ApplicationOptions<ApplicationCriteria>, Criteria<ApplicationCriteria>, Options
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultApplicationCriteria

    public interface ApplicationCriteria
extends Criteria<ApplicationCriteria>, ApplicationOptions<ApplicationCriteria>
    An Application-specific Criteria class, enabling an Application-specific fluentquery DSL. ApplicationCriteria instances can be constructed by using the Applications utility class, for example: 
     Applications.where(Applications.name().containsIgnoreCase("CRM"))
     .and(Applications.status().eq(ApplicationStatus.ENABLED))
     .orderByName()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .limitTo(10));

    Sort Order

    All of the orderBy* methods append an orderBy clause to the query, ensuring the query results reflect a particular sort order.

    The default sort order is always ascending, but can be changed to descending by calling the Criteria.descending() method immediately after the orderBy method call. For example: 

     ...criteria.orderByName().descending()...

    Multiple Order Statements

    You may specify multiple orderBy clauses and the query results will ordered, reflecting orderBy statements in the order they are declared. For example, to order the results first by name (ascending) and then further by status (descending), you would chain orderBy statements: 
     ...criteria
     .orderByName()
     .orderByStatus().descending()
     ...
    Since:
    0.8
